info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued December 23 at 1:42AM MST until December 24 at 6:00PM MST by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE FRIDAY MORNING THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING FOR RELATIVE HUMIDITY BELOW 25 PERCENT, 20FT WINDS OF 20 MPH OR MORE, AND VERY HIGH FIRE DANGER FOR THE NORTHERN PERMIAN BASIN, SOUTHEAST NEW MEXICO, SACRAMENTO MOUNTAINS AND FOOTHILLS, DAVIS MOUNTAINS AND FOOTHILLS, GUADALUPE AND DELAWARE MOUNTAINS, CULBERSON AND REEVES COUNTIES... .A shortwave trough will set up a jet max across much of New Mexico and part of the Permian Basin, resulting in very strong 20ft winds across much of the region. Despite humidity remaining mostly above critical levels on Friday, the high winds, record breaking high temperatures, and ERCs in the 70th-90th percentile will allow any fires that develop to have the ability to spread rapidly and uncontrollably. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE FRIDAY MORNING THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING FOR RELATIVE HUMIDITY BELOW 25 PERCENT, 20FT WINDS OF 20 MPH OR MORE, AND VERY HIGH FIRE DANGER FOR THE NORTHERN PERMIAN BASIN, SOUTHEAST NEW MEXICO, SACRAMENTO MOUNTAINS AND FOOTHILLS, DAVIS MOUNTAINS AND FOOTHILLS, GUADALUPE AND DELAWARE MOUNTAINS, CULBERSON AND REEVES COUNTIES... * AFFECTED AREA...Gaines, Dawson, Borden, Scurry, Andrews, Martin, Howard, Mitchell, Sacramento Foothills and Guadalupe Mountains, Chaves Plains, Eddy Plains, Lea, Guadalupe Mountains Above 7000 Feet, Guadalupe and Delaware Mountains, Van Horn and Highway 54 Corridor, Eastern Culberson County, Reeves County Plains, Davis Mountains and Davis Mountains Foothills. * TIMING...Late Friday morning through Friday afternoon. * WINDS...Southwest 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 50 mph. Higher winds expected in the mountains. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 14 percent. * RFTI...3 to 4 or near critical. * IMPACTS...Avoid the use of open flames or any activities that may generate sparks. Accidental ignitions will have the potential to grow into dangerous wind-driven wildfires
info.instruction: A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.
